title: [Large-Scale] Collaborative Design Workshop for Language-Based Self-Reflection Tools in Maker Education: Strengthening Multicultural Learners' Reading and Expression Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic maker education concepts, UX design foundations, project management experience, foundational language skills (reading, writing, speaking, listening), and basic knowledge of multicultural learners' characteristics and language development stages
context.additional_context: Strengthening Capabilities in Developing Collaborative Tools for Multicultural and Interdisciplinary Environments. Particularly emphasizing tool design that considers the cultural backgrounds and language development stages of language-minority learners, with the goal of integrating text-based interaction and visual expression methods. Includes a Structured Feedback System for Improving Writing Skills and Context-Based Vocabulary Recommendation Features for Reading Support

learning_goals: Applying a collaborative design (co-design) process, learners must complete a language-based self-reflection tool design for maker education at least 80%, integrating a feedback mechanism supporting learners’ grammar and vocabulary acquisition.

Learners must develop user-centered solution capabilities aligned with the four UX design phases (analysis–design–prototype–evaluation), particularly strengthening interface design skills reflecting multicultural learners’ reading and expression needs and text-visual integration abilities.

Within four weeks, learners must develop one digital reflection tool prototype (implementing at least three functional requirements) based on needs analysis of a multicultural learner group (minimum five members), then submit verifiable results through user testing (satisfaction rate over 70%). The prototype must include a feedback mechanism supporting grammar/vocabulary acquisition and interaction scenarios reflecting cultural contexts.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
